intro: Trevia rusciflora, commonly known as the leafy trevia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
